pull.title: random: remove call to RAND_screen() (Windows only)
pull.body: Follow up to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17151 where there were multiple calls to also remove our call to RAND_screen().

random: remove call to RAND_screen() (Windows only)

Follow up to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17151 where
there were multiple calls to also remove our call to RAND_screen().

events.body:
ACK e892f9648ae5f72b2020bdaa1e28901e8378e9fc

Though after this I'd prefer to wait for #17165 and rip OpenSSL usage out all at once, instead of statement for statement :smile:

issue.title: Remove BIP70 support
issue.body: This removes [BIP70](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0070.mediawiki) support. It also removes OpenSSL linking from Qt and building OpenSSLs `lib_ssl` in depends, as well as SSL lib detection from the build system. It's something that I'd optimistically like to do for `0.20.0`.

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.

issue.title: [Refactor] Update RNG code from upstream
issue.body:
This is a collection of upstream PRs that have been backported to bring our RNG (`src/random`) code more up-to-date. The following upstream PRs have been included here:

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12742
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14624 
  - some of this had already been merged previously
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14955
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15250
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15224
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15324
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15296
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15512
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16878
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17151
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17191
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13236
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13314
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17169
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17270
  -  omitted last commit as our testing framework doesn't support it currently
  - omitted https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17270/commits/64e1e022cedf6776c5dffd488ca2e766adca5dc3, to be pulled in after our time utility is updated in a separate PR
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17573
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17507
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17670
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17527
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14127
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21486

issue.title: util: Remove deprecated random number generator functions
issue.body:
This commit changes CInit to check for proper RNG seeding and use RAND_poll() if necessary. It removes RandAddSeed() RandAddSeedPerfmon() and also the use of RAND_screen. **[Update - RandAddSeed() and RandAddSeedPerfmon() have been retained, but a macro conditional changes what they do.]**

OpenSSL in 1.1.0+ has fixed entropy source issues that obviate the kludges that were in the code to collect additional entropy from Performance Counters/screen etc. In 1.1.0+, OpenSSL automatically seeds (and reseeds) the RNG with entropy from trusted sources without intervention. Obviously the super simple approach to this is something like what I have done in this PR.

There are several big issues remaining however:
1. Some operating systems that are still being supported are using 1.0.2 such as Ubuntu Xenial (16.04), which has problems with the RNG that were fixed in 1.1.0+.
2. The documentation for RAND in OpenSSL states explicity that the status (error return value ) of RAND_bytes() should be checked at each call, because a transient failure of the entropy sources could cause the RNG to not have enough entropy and then degrade into not providing valid random numbers. As far as I can tell this is not done in ANY of the code. RTFM. We should at a minimum put a wrapper around the vanilla RAND_bytes() with a reseed try using RAND_poll() if the call to RAND_bytes() gives an unsuccessful status.
3. A short review of Bitcoin's current RNG code in random.cpp/h shows a far more advanced approach where they essentially largely wrote their own RNG. I am not sure we are ready to drop-ship that in yet.

If people are nervous about removing the RandAddSeed / RandAddSeedPerfmon in places that originally were critical points where more entropy was desired, we could simply call RAND_poll() there, or put RandAddSeed() back in place as a simple wrapper.

Comments?
